Issues.Title: Fix MenuStrip hover & click behavior in unfocused windows
Issues.Body:
(split off from #2476)

This issue addresses two differences between native MainMenu and MenuStrip controls when the window is unfocused.

### Issue 1 : Hovering menu items highlights them in an unfocused window
Native control on the right side only highlights hovered items when the window is focused. This also causes confusion with issue 2.

![unfocused](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3685160/71302833-64c3ef00-23b0-11ea-9846-001262d4af04.png)

### Issue 2 : Clicking a menu item in unfocused window does not open it
To reproduce, open the test project which opens 2 windows as seen on the screenshot above, click the taskbar or another window to unfocus them, and then click **Item 1** in each window. You will see that:

* In the **FormStripSystem** window which uses a MenuStrip, clicking highlights the window but does not open the menu. State after clicking:
![focusedstrip](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3685160/71302930-b1f49080-23b1-11ea-98b8-6b62a38c3c4e.png)

* In the **FormNative** window which uses a native MainMenu, clicking both highlights the window and immediately opens the menu. State after clicking:
![focusednative](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3685160/71302939-d3ee1300-23b1-11ea-8859-78f97636a412.png)

The behavior of MenuStrip should be changed to match the native control.

As I said in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/2476#issuecomment-567316912, I tested several applications with both native MainMenu and completely custom menu controls, all of which follow the native Windows behavior, so the non-standard behavior of MenuStrip is likely confusing to Windows users.

### Test Project

[winforms.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3990977/winforms.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Fix MenuStrip hover & click behavior in unfocused windows" (#2544)

Issues.Title: Make appearance of MenuStrip & ContextMenuStrip look native when RenderMode = System
Issues.Body:
(split off from #2476)

### Windows 7

See #2476 for screenshots if needed.

### Windows 10

| Native | Strip (RenderMode = System) |
| --- | --- |
| ![NativeMenu10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3685160/70310185-5a7dee80-180f-11ea-9ae7-f970c6b69bbe.png) | ![StripSystemMenu10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3685160/70310193-5eaa0c00-180f-11ea-9f91-48f14507a707.png) |
| ![NativeContext10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3685160/70308793-57353380-180c-11ea-8005-d8035212a269.png) | ![StripSystemContext10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3685160/70308811-5f8d6e80-180c-11ea-9296-dc97f56403c3.png) |
| ![a](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3685160/71302072-76ed5f80-23a7-11ea-9ae8-6e962c33e02d.png) | ![b](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3685160/71302073-7ce34080-23a7-11ea-9ddf-e9d30cda74aa.png) |
| ![bb](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3685160/71302431-24ae3d80-23ab-11ea-9291-d15d91426084.png) | ![aa](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3685160/71302436-2b3cb500-23ab-11ea-92ba-e588d7e69c72.png) |

### List of Differences

It's probably not worth matching the look of Windows 7, so I will only consider differences from the Windows 10 look.

I have done measurements on 100% and 150% DPI, and marked those that change. I have not measured widths/heights of items, those seem mostly fine.

- **Main Menu**
  - [ ] Menu height should be (19px * DPI)
  - [ ] Make menu items flush with the left and top side of the window (no padding/border between them)
  - [ ] The menu background from top to bottom is (19px * DPI - 1px) of RGB(255, 255, 255), and then 1px bottom border of RGB(242, 242, 242)
    - Note that item highlight overlays the bottom border and the top of sub-menus is just below the bottom border
  - [ ] Set highlighted item background to RGB(204, 232, 255)
  - [ ] Set highlighted item border to 1px of RGB(153, 209, 255)
  - [ ] Do not invert text color of highlighted items
  - [ ] Reduce left/right padding of menu items (appears to be 1px for border + (6px * DPI) of padding)
- **Context Menu & Main Menu sub-menus**
  - [ ] Set border color to RGB(204, 204, 204)
  - [ ] Set overall background color to RGB(242, 242, 242), so that non-highlighted items and padding between items and border is this color
  - [ ] Set checkmark/image column background color to RGB(240, 240, 240)
  - [ ] Set highlighted item background color to RGB(144, 200, 246)
  - [ ] Fix the weird white line on the left of highlighted items
  - [ ] Do not invert text color of highlighted items
  - [ ] Increase padding between the items and border (1px -> 2px)
  - [ ] Update icon of arrow on items with sub-menus and move it up by 1 px to center it
  - [ ] Make splitter 1px tall
  - [ ] Set splitter color to RGB(215, 215, 215)
  - [ ] Fix splitter padding (it should not leak into the checkmark/image column, and be 2px from the right border)
  - [ ] Set checkmark color to RGB(51, 51, 51)
  - [ ] Checkmark should have a background color RGB(144, 200, 246) when checked, or RGB(86, 176, 250) when checked and highlighted at the same time
  - [ ] Sub-menus should overlap their parent menu item by 6 pixels on the left, and be flush with the top
  - [ ] After highlighting an item with a sub-menu and then moving cursor to a sibling item above/below, the original highlighted item should immediately become unhighlighted
    - Currently the highlight lingers until the sub-menu disappears (see last screenshot)

It's a lot ^.^ but it should make them almost completely visually indistinguishable from native controls.

### (Updated) Test Project

[winforms.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3990977/winforms.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Make appearance of MenuStrip & ContextMenuStrip look native when RenderMode = System" (#2543)

Issues.Title: Incorrect a tooltip text announcing by SreenReader in different OS versions
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 5.0.100-alpha1-015918
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**
- Some users in different OS versions have a problem with a tooltip text announcing.

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
- **RS5** OS version (2018): Narrator announces a tooltip text **once**. But after #2074 Narrator announces a text **twice**.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/71243924-7068d480-2322-11ea-8404-975bf60d3211.png)


- **19H2** OS version (2019): Narrator doesn't announce a tooltip text. But after #2074 Narrator announces a text **once**.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/71243523-90e45f00-2321-11ea-968a-917d25816e7a.png)


**Expected behavior:**
- ScreenReader should announce a tooltip text once.

**Minimal repro:**
- Create a Core 5.0 app
- Add a control to the app
- Add a tooltip text to the control
- Run Narrator and listen to what it says when showing a tooltip
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Incorrect a tooltip text announcing by SreenReader in different OS versions" (#2538)

Issues.Title: An exception pops up when executing these methods: ImageList.Images.Clear() and ListViewItem.ImageList.Image.Clear()
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (.NET Core 5.0 5.0.100.15949 5.0.0-alpha.1.19617.3 )
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
**More Info**
1. This issue cannot reproduce with Framework app.
2. This issue cannot reproduce when targeting .NET Core 3.1.

**Problem description:**
An exception pops up when the cases implement the following affected methods: ImageList.Images.Clear() and ListViewItem.ImageList.Image.Clear()

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
An exception pops up.
![Actual](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18568603/71078995-5ebdea80-21c5-11ea-8024-6792c37e2e46.PNG)

**Expected behavior:**
There should no any exception popping up.

**Minimal repro:**
1.	Run the attached project. 
[ImageClearIssue.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3977900/ImageClearIssue.zip)

2.	Click the any of the buttons on the form, then wait seconds.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "An exception pops up when executing these methods: ImageList.Images.Clear() and ListViewItem.ImageList.Image.Clear()" (#2522)

- **Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents** -> 5.0.0-alpha.1.19620.3 (parent: Microsoft.NETCore.App)
- **System.CodeDom** -> 5.0.0-alpha.1.19620.3 (parent: Microsoft.NETCore.App)

Issues.Title: The text and image of the ToolStripMenutems cannot be shown completely
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (.NET Core 5.0.100-alpha1-015949)
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?:No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**
The text and image of the ToolStripMenuItems cannot be shown completely.

**More Info:**
1. This is a regression issue, it's not reproducing when targeting .NET Core 3.1.
2. This issue also cannot reproduce with Framework project.
3. This issue affected ContextMenuStrip, MenuStrip, StatusStrip, ToolStrip, BindingNavigator controls.


**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
The text and image of the ToolStripMenuItems shows not correctly.
.NET Core 5.0 screenshot
![Issue5-withprivate](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53589182/71084395-21128f00-21d0-11ea-9e7b-4557e85fa47e.png)

**Expected behavior:**
The  text and image should be displayed correctly and completely.
.NET Core 3.1 screenshot
![Issue5-withoutprivate](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53589182/71084635-b2820100-21d0-11ea-93c6-e3be6f951796.png)

**Minimal repro:**
1. Run attached app.
[ItemDisplayIssue.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3978260/ItemDisplayIssue.zip)
2. Observe the display of the ToolStripMenuItems.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The text and image of the ToolStripMenutems cannot be shown completely" (#2525)

Issues.Title: The text of the selected drop-down list item is invisible in PropertyGrid
Issues.Body:
**.NET Core Version:** .NET Core 5.0.100-alpha1-15949 from Release branch + the VSIX Inserted into Dev16 16.5.0 Preview 2.0 [29617.90.master]
**Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?:** No

**More info:**
1.	This issue cannot reproduce when the application target to 3.0 or 3.1.
2.	This issue cannot reproduce in design time.
 
**Repro Steps:**
1.	Open the attached ‘WindowsFormsApp17’ .NET Core app in VS.
2.	Build and run this application, select a drop-down and expend it.
 
[WindowsFormsApp17.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3978229/WindowsFormsApp17.zip)

**Actual Result:**
The text of the selected drop-down list item is invisible.

**Expect Result:** 
The selected drop-down list item should display its own text.

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The text of the selected drop-down list item is invisible in PropertyGrid" (#2523)

Issues.Title: Solution restructure
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->


## Proposed changes

- Move all interops and required common definitions into a dedicated project System.Windows.Forms.Primitives. This will allow simpler maintenance of shared types definitions.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- None, this is an infra change
